definition: insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Male models can use fade turns in combination to create a stunning runway walk.
sentences.chinese: 男模特可以使用淡入組合來創造一個驚人的跑道走。

sentences.english: Is there a built in way to fade between layers?
sentences.chinese: 有沒有層間淡入淡出的內部方法？

sentences.english: The fade turn is the most professional modeling turn for runway walking.
sentences.chinese: 淡入淡出的又是最專業的跑道造型轉走。

sentences.english: After the introduction, we'll fade in the first scene.
sentences.chinese: 我們在序幕之後，就使第一個場景淡入。

sentences.english: Many designers make this mistake by using Flash menus such as those fade-in and animated menus.
sentences.chinese: 很多設計師使用淡入的動畫菜單從而犯了這個錯誤。

sentences.english: The fade blink speed on collision.
FADE IN: WE ARE FLYING through mist, a dimly glimpsed forest below.
sentences.chinese: 淡入:我們正飛越薄霧，下面朦朧可以瞥見森林。

sentences.english: In a slide show, the images appear in a timed sequence, with images fading in and out.
sentences.chinese: 在幻燈片瀏覽中，圖像按照時間順序先後淡入淡出。

sentences.english: What do I make of the way the historical scale of Nazism drifts in and out of this poem?
sentences.chinese: 我如何理解納粹主義在這首詩中淡入淡出的歷史氛圍？

sentences.english: Animation duration in milliseconds for shade effect.
sentences.chinese: 以毫秒爲單位的淡入淡出效果的動畫時長。

sentences.english: Notice how the menu buttons fade-in and out.
sentences.chinese: 請注意如何菜單按鈕淡入和了。

sentences.english: I would like every element and each page on the website to fade-in from the black background.
sentences.chinese: 我想每個元素，每個網站上的淡入從黑色背景頁。

sentences.english: On the home page, the photos fade-in and out.
sentences.chinese: 在主頁上，照片淡入進出。

definition: to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions
insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen
ups and downs (of life etc)/to drift along/to sink and emerge
to fade into the distance/(fig.) to peter out/to fade away
gradually proceed, gradually get further apart
to slow down gradually/slower and slower/(music) decelerando/ritardando
the past is vanished like the wind; gone beyond recall
(theater) blackout (e.g. at the end of a scene)/(literary) to be promoted in rank secretly
